    • Constructor Detail

      • PaperScreen

        public PaperScreen()
        Create a new PaperScreen, a Papart object has to be created first. A PaperScreen is a rendering / interacting space like a Processing Sketch. PaperScreen usually have their own rendering (PGraphics object): this is the drawOnPaper() mode. They can be rendererd directly on the Display, usually for 3D effects: this is the drawAroundPaper().

      • PaperScreen

        public PaperScreen(processing.core.PApplet mainApplet,
                   Camera cam,
                   BaseDisplay proj)
        Create a PaperScreen with a given camera and display. Instanciation without the use of a Papart object.
        Parameters:
        mainApplet -
        cam -
        proj -

      • PaperScreen

        public PaperScreen(BaseDisplay display)
        Start without a camera. The paperScreen location has to be manually set. This is used for debug mode.
        Parameters:
        display -

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        protected void setup()
        This method must be overloaded in the child class. For example to load images, 3D models etc...

      • settings

        protected void settings()
        This method must be overloaded in the child class. For example to choose the rendering mode (setDrawAroundPaper, setDrawOnPaper).

      • reInitialize

        public void reInitialize()
        Call the settings() method again, and initialize the offscreen rendering if necessary. Will also re-initialize the tracking.

      • pre

        public void pre()
        Do not call, Automatically called by Processing. This method initialises the display if necessary.

      • useManualLocation

        public void useManualLocation(boolean manual,
                              processing.core.PMatrix3D loc)
        Activate/Desactivate the tracking. This is called when loadLocationFrom() is called.
        Parameters:
        manual - true to activate, false to revert to tracking
        loc - forced location, or null to use the tracked location

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(processing.core.PVector v)
        Add a vector to the tracked location. The setLocation do not stack up. It replaces the previous call.
        Parameters:
        v - in millimeters

      • goTo

        public void goTo(PaperScreen paperScreen)
        * Works only in 3D mode with beginDraw3D(). Change the currernt matrix to the location of another PaperScreen. This could be used for drawing objects or putting lights at another PaperScreen location.
        Parameters:
        paperScreen - PaperScreen to go to.

      • getCoordFrom

        public processing.core.PVector getCoordFrom(PaperScreen paperScreen,
                                            processing.core.PVector point)
        Get the Location of a point located in another PaperScreen. Example:In paperScreenA, there is an object at location (10, 10). We want to know the 3D location of this point relative to this PaperScreen.
        Parameters:
        paperScreen -
        point -
        Returns:

      • createTouchFromMouse

        public Touch createTouchFromMouse()
        Project the Mouse to this PaperScreen. You can disable it by pressing the right button of the mouse. Similar to SkatoloLink "AddMouseTo".
        Returns:
        Touch to add to your touchList

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        Returns:
        true if the markerboard can move through tracking.

      • setMainLocation

        public void setMainLocation(processing.core.PMatrix3D location)
        Force the 3D location of the markerBoard, as if it were coming from tracking. You can instead add another position with setLocation().
        Parameters:
        location -

      • getLocationVector

        public processing.core.PVector getLocationVector()
        Get the 3D location of the PaperScreen (bottom-right corner). It takes into account the call to setLocation().
        Returns:

      • getLocation

        Returns:

      • saveLocationTo

        public void saveLocationTo(String filename)
        Save the tracked location of the PaperScreen. You still need to do the setLocation after loading this.
        Parameters:
        filename -

      • loadLocationFrom

        public void loadLocationFrom(String filename)
        Load the tracked location of the PaperScreen. You still need to do the setLocation after loading this. Calling this will disable the tracking.
        Parameters:
        filename -

      • loadLocationFrom

        public void loadLocationFrom(processing.core.PMatrix3D mat)

        public void addDisplay(BaseDisplay display)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the quality of rendering in px/mm.

      • isIsDrawingOnScreen

        public boolean isIsDrawingOnScreen()
        Returns:
        true when using an offscreen.

      • loadMarkerBoard

        public void loadMarkerBoard(String configFile,
                            float width,
                            float height)
        Load a Markerboard with the given configuration file and size. The configuration file can end with ".svg" for an ARToolKitPlus tracking technique. (faster) The configuration file can end with ".jpg" or ".png" to track "images" using SURF features. (slower) Call from settings();
        Parameters:
        configFile - svg filename
        width - width of the markerboard in millimeters.
        height - height of the markerboard in millimeters.

      • setMarkerBoard

        public void setMarkerBoard(MarkerBoard markerboard)
        Assign an existing markerboard to this PaperScreen.

      • setQuality

        public void setQuality(float quality)
        Set the quality (resolution) of the drawing in px/mm . e.g.: A board with 100mm width and 2 resolution will have 200 pixels. Call from settings

      • setDrawingSize

        public final void setDrawingSize(float width,
                                 float height)
        Sets the drawing size in millimeters. To get the resolution you must multiply the drawing size by the resolution. Call from settings()
        Parameters:
        width - in millimeters
        height - in millimeters

      • setDrawAroundPaper

        public void setDrawAroundPaper()
        Draw in the Display, beware of the order of drawing. If you call clear() you may remove rendering from other PaperScreens. Call from settings()

      • setDrawOnPaper

        public void setDrawOnPaper()
        Draw in an offscreen buffer. Ideal for 2D rendering. Easy to use. Call from settings()

      • setDrawStandard

        public void setDrawStandard()
        Alias for setDrawOnPaper(). Call from settings().

      • setDrawingFilter

        protected void setDrawingFilter(float distance)
        Disable the tracking if the movement is below the distance distance. Call from settings()
        Parameters:
        distance - 0 to disable, or any distance in millimeter.

      • setTrackingFilter

        protected void setTrackingFilter(float freq,
                                 float cutOff)
        Set the filters values for the time filters. Call from settings()
        Parameters:
        freq -
        cutOff -

      • initDraw

        public void initDraw(Camera cam,
                     processing.core.PVector userPos)
        Initialize VR rendering.
        Parameters:
        cam -
        userPos -

      • initDraw

        public void initDraw(Camera cam,
                     processing.core.PVector userPos,
                     float nearPlane,
                     float farPlane)
        Initialize VR rendering.
        Parameters:
        cam -
        userPos -

      • initDraw

        public void initDraw(Camera cam,
                     processing.core.PVector userPos,
                     float nearPlane,
                     float farPlane,
                     boolean isAnaglyph,
                     boolean isLeft)
        Init VR rendering. The VR rendering creates a 3D "screen". It is used to create 3D pop-up effects.
        Parameters:
        cam - Rendering origin.
        userPos - Position of the user, relative to the PaperScreen
        nearPlane - Close disance for OpengL in millimeters.
        farPlane - Far distance for OpenGL in millimeters.
        isAnaglyph - Use Anaglyph.
        isLeft - When analygph is it left or right, ignored otherwise.

      • endDrawPerspective
